intro: Viola incisa, commonly known as the cutleaf violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to parts of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring heart-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its flowers are typically violet or purple, with five petals, and bloom in early spring. Viola incisa is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soil.
